alert.note: Alert for Barry; Lawrence (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 8:54AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Barry and southern Lawrence Counties through 915 AM CDT... At 851 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Pierce City to Purdy to Seligman. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Verona around 910 AM CDT. Aurora and Marionville around 915 AM CDT. Western portions of Table Rock Lake around 915 AM CDT Other locations impacted by these storms include Shell Knob, Arrow Point, Wheelerville, Butterfield, Emerald Beach, Jenkins, Wayne, Mcdowell, Pleasant Ridge and Pioneer. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near western portions of Table Rock Lake seek safe shelter out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
